comments:
In RC3 (not noticed this before, but cannot guarantee it wasn't there), I have 
a situation where some of my Java files do not appear in the Open Type dialog.

I have a new workspace (newly created with RC3) consisting of 6 projects. All 
projects were retrieved from CVS, and I have done nothing but file edits - no 
new files, or file deletions etc...

When I do an open type, I have noticed that at least one class (and its 
nested, inner classes) does not appear in the list.

The file in question does exist in Package Explorer, and will quite happily 
open if I double-click it in that view.

This is a disturbing situation as there is nothing about this class that would 
suggest a problem.

Here is the contents of my .log file, although I cannot infer any connection 
between this problem and the logged exceptions...

Ian, do you have any steps to reproduce it. Is the source you checked out 
public available and can you tell me which class is missing.

What happens if you close the workspace and reopen it. Will the Opent Type 
dialog contain all files or is the same file still missing?

The exceptions above are very likely not related to this problem.

Ian, 

could it be that the CU from which the types are missing had syntax errors. 
There are cases where this can lead to missing types.

Sadly, I have no steps to reproduce it.

The file was one that I had been editing so /may/ have had errors in it (sadly 
unable to recall as I was also suffering from stale decorators at the time - 
issue 62113). I don't think that it was the case at the time, although it 
probably was earlier during my Eclipse session - and as I use Open Type a lot, 
there may have been a time when it was broken when I did Open Type.

Eventually, I resorted to opening the class from Package Explorer and, 
sometime later on, after a restart, the class re-appeared in the list.

Would like to write this off as a one-off, but sadly as my workspace has 600+ 
java files in it (across 6 projects), for all I know there is more than one 
absentee file - and I just happened to have only noticed one of them (!)

Sadly can't share the code, but will report back if it happens again.

As I couldn't see the file's inner classes in Open Type either, I'm presuming 
that the whole CU had opted out for some reason. It is the most complex file 
in the project, but not excessively so (1800 lines)

More info if I can get it...

Ian, thanks for the update. I will mark the bug as resolved later. Please 
reopen if you have more information.
